newsitem.title: USA: NBA BASKETBALL-FIREWORKS AND EARPLUGS SPELL HOME VICTORY FOR JAZZ.
newsitem.headline: NBA BASKETBALL-FIREWORKS AND EARPLUGS SPELL HOME VICTORY FOR JAZZ.

text.p: The Delta Centre is considered the loudest arena in the NBA, and that's just the way the Utah Jazz like it.

Before Friday's Game 3, the Jazz set off deafening fireworks inside the building and released thousands of balloons -- which promptly had to be popped, by fans and at least one Delta Centre worker with a knife.

"You saw it tonight, It helps us tremendously," said bench hero Greg Foster after the 104-93 win that reduced the Chicago Bulls' lead in the best-of-seven series to 2-1. "We have a lot of confidence playing here at home.
"And the fans are very knowledgeable about the game, they really get after it. This is the only show in town, and they're behind us all the way."

Salt Lake City is the smallest city to boast an NBA team, but the Jazz -- cheered on by their screaming fans -- were the league's best team at home, losing just three games all season including the playoffs.
"Energy-wise they're a different ball club at home," said Chicago coach Phil Jackson. "Obviously, this crowd is outrageous, what they do before the game is totally beyond limits.
"I'm bringing earplugs the next time before the game starts so I don't get hearing loss, or else I'm going to sue this organisation for hearing loss."
